channel.title: Compile help rep++ and admin on my server
channel.description:
Hello all iv got a little problem with my compile because when i go to load it up it comes up with this Note:some input files use or override a deprecated API Note:Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked or unsafe operations. Note:some input files use or override a deprecated API Note:Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked or unsafe operations.
If you can help me that would be great i am also having problems with getting my server online add me on skype (Gladooo96) if you can help me rep++ and admin on my server.

item.title: Compile help rep++ and admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:12, topic:439282”][quote author=S W A G G A link=topic=541984.msg3970991#msg3970991 date=1334152051]
when i use 127.0.0.1 it workes for me and not for other’s and just had some1 try to help me and when i go to start CMD ipconfig it come’s up with an error saying
ipconfig is not recognized as an internal or external command
Iv done my no-ip.biz iv tryed changing all the ip’s does’nt seem to be working if any1 is PRO at 639 source and client let me know or again add me on skype and the person who does this will get admin on my server and rep++
[/quote]

This thread was confusing to follow along with… Those are not “errors” persay in your compiler. However, you should try to replace calls to deprecated APIs with solutions that don’t use a deprecated API.

The reason why 127.0.0.1 works for you and not others is because that’s the localhost. In computer networking, localhost also means: this computer. Thus why you and only you are allowed to connect to your server. To allow others to connect you will have to include your IP (preferably static IP address). If you’re unable to find your IP address by typing “ipconfig” into your terminal then you should contact your ISP in order to find out your information. I also do believe they have the rights to set up your router/modem to be portforwarded.[/quote]
They do not have to do any configuration to your router unless it is specifically purchased from that company alone. I tried to call my ISP before I could finally figure out why I couldn’t port forward (turned out that my modem was bridged/PPPoE when it should only act as a bridge) but unfortunately, they had no clue of what I was talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Compile help rep++ and admin on my server

item.title: Compile help rep++ and admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“S W A G G A, post:9, topic:439282”]when i use 127.0.0.1 it workes for me and not for other’s and just had some1 try to help me and when i go to start CMD ipconfig it come’s up with an error saying
ipconfig is not recognized as an internal or external command
Iv done my no-ip.biz iv tryed changing all the ip’s does’nt seem to be working if any1 is PRO at 639 source and client let me know or again add me on skype and the person who does this will get admin on my server and rep++[/quote]

This thread was confusing to follow along with… Those are not “errors” persay in your compiler. However, you should try to replace calls to deprecated APIs with solutions that don’t use a deprecated API.

The reason why 127.0.0.1 works for you and not others is because that’s the localhost. In computer networking, localhost also means: this computer. Thus why you and only you are allowed to connect to your server. To allow others to connect you will have to include your IP (preferably static IP address). If you’re unable to find your IP address by typing “ipconfig” into your terminal then you should contact your ISP in order to find out your information. I also do believe they have the rights to set up your router/modem to be portforwarded.

Read full topic
